chinese: 则届时所获功德将尽数奉于你坛上
pinyin: Zé jièshí suǒ huò gōngdé jiāng jìnshù fèng yú nǐtán shàng.
translation: At that time, all the merits obtained will be fully dedicated to your altar.

breakdown.meaning: (that which is) obtained (所 = that which, 获 = obtain)
fully, entirely (尽 = fully, 数 = number/extent)
dedicated to (奉 = dedicate, 于 = to)
your altar (你 = your, 坛 = altar, 上 = on/above)

pinyin: Zhè bùshì tàizi diàn xià ma?
translation: Isn't this His Royal Highness the Crown Prince?

breakdown.meaning: crown prince (太 = grand/court, 子 = son)
His Royal Highness (殿 = hall/palace, 下 = below/under)
question particle, equivalent to '吗' in modern Chinese

pinyin: Duō shǎohuí le - méi wánméi le a.
translation: How many times has this been going on endlessly?

breakdown.meaning: how much/many (多 = more, 少 = little)
times/returned (回 = return, 了 = particle indicating completion)
endless/unending (没 = not, 完 = finish, 没了 = didn't end)

pinyin: Tā zěnme yòu fēishēng le.
translation: How did he soar again?

breakdown.meaning: to soar, to fly up (飞 = fly, 升 = rise)

pinyin: Diàn xià zhè shì yòu huílái le.
translation: Your Highness, you have returned again.

pinyin: Dōu dìsān cì le.
translation: It's the third time.

chinese: 就是啊-我赌他这次撑不了一年
pinyin: Jiùshì a - wǒ dǔ tā zhè cì chēng bù liǎo yī nián.
translation: Yeah, I bet he won't last a year this time.

breakdown.meaning: can't hold out (撑 = to support, 不了 = can't)

chinese: 一年也太长了吧-上次他一炷香的时间就下去了
pinyin: Yī nián yě tàizhǎng le ba - Shàngcì tā yī zhù xiāng de shíjiān jiù xiàqù le.
translation: It's been too long, right? Last time he went down in the time it takes to burn an incense stick.

breakdown.meaning: too long (太 = very, 长 = long)
particle used for suggestion or invitation
last time/time before (上 = previous, 次 = time/instance)
one incense stick/incense burn time (一 = one,  = incense stick, 香 = incense)
went down (xià qù le) where le indicates past tense.

pinyin: Wǒ dǔ sān tiān.
translation: I bet for three days.

chinese: 刚才灵文殿说帝君要借人，
pinyin: Gāngcái lingwén diàn shuō dì jūn yào jiè rén.
translation: Just now, the Temple of Lingwen said that the Emperor wanted to borrow someone.

chinese: 莫不是给太子殿下借的吧
pinyin: Mò búshì gěi tàizi diàn xià jiè de ba.
translation: Is it perhaps borrowed from the Crown Prince?

breakdown.meaning: 殿下一个 respectful title for princes or royalty

chinese: 肯定是现在最缺人的就是他谢怜了
pinyin: Kěndìng shì xiànzài zuì quērén de jiùshì tā xièlián le.
translation: It must be Xie Lian who is most lacking right now.

breakdown.meaning: must, definitely (肯 = willing, 定 = determined)
lacking people (缺 = lacking, 人 = person)
is, is that (就 = just, 是 = is)
Xie Lian (a proper noun, personal name)
particle indicating completion of an action

chinese: 无香火无宫观无信徒-三无神官三界笑柄
pinyin: Wú xiānghuǒ wú gōng guān wú xìntú - sān wú shénguān sānjiè xiàobǐng.
translation: Without incense offerings, without temples, and without believers - a 'three-without' divine official becomes a laughingstock of the three realms.

breakdown.meaning: incense offerings (香 = incense, 火 = fire)
temples or shrines (宫 = palace/court, 观 = observe/watch)
three withouts (三 = three, 无 = none)
divine official or priest (神 = god/divine, 官 = official)
three realms (三 = three, 界 = realm)
laughingstock or object of ridicule (笑 = laugh, 柄 = handle/means)

pinyin: Nǐ kàn wǒ shuō jiè bù lái rén ba.
translation: Look, I told you we can't borrow people.

breakdown.meaning: look at me (看 = look, 我 = I/me)
can't come/borrow (不 = not, 來 = come)

pinyin: Dàjiā hǎo wǒ yòu huílái le.
translation: Hello everyone, I'm back again.

breakdown.meaning: to come back; to return (回 = return, 来 = come)
auxiliary particle indicating completion of an action

chinese: 殿下这次飞升真是好大的阵仗啊
pinyin: Diàn xià zhè cì fēishēngzhēn shì hǎodà de zhènzhàng ah.
translation: Your Highness, this ascension is truly quite a grand spectacle!

breakdown.meaning: Your Highness (殿 = palace/royalty, 下 = below)
to ascend (飞 = fly/rise, 升 = rise)
quite big/large (好 = good, 大 = big)
the grand spectacle/arrangement (阵 = array, 仗 = arms/spectacle)
particle used for emphasis or感叹

pinyin: Háihǎo
translation: It's still OK, it's still good.

chinese: 太子殿下是好我就不太好了
pinyin: Tàizi diàn xià shì hǎo wǒ jiù bù tàihǎo le.
translation: Your Highness is good, so I'm not feeling well.

breakdown.meaning: Your Highness (a respectful title for a prince or公子)
am not feeling well (不 = not, 太好 = too good, 了 = aspect particle)

pinyin: Diàn xià nà gè zhōng.
translation: Your Highness, that clock.

chinese: 钟的事我听说了砸到你真是万分抱歉
pinyin: Zhōng de shì wǒ tīngshuō le zá dào nǐ zhēn shì wànfēn bàoqiàn.
translation: I heard about the clock incident and I'm truly very sorry for breaking it.

breakdown.meaning: possessive particle (used to indicate possession or association)
heard (tīng = to hear, shuō = to speak; 'le' indicates the action has been completed)
broke into you (zá = to crash, dào = to hit; 'nǐ' = you)
extremely sorry (wàn fēn = ten thousand parts, bào qiàn = to apologize)

pinyin: Qǐngwèn  Gé xià zěnme chēnghū.
translation: May I inquire about your name, please?

pinyin: Diàn xià zhè dōu wàng le.
translation: Your Highness forgot about this.

breakdown.meaning: all, every; in this case meaning 'about' or 'of'
particle indicating completion of the action

pinyin: Shīyì le
translation: Amnesia

pinyin: Dìan xià nà shì xuánzhēn.
translation: Your Highness, that's Xuanzhen.

pinyin: Xuán xuánzhēn ？Tā shì mù qíng ？
translation: Is he Xuán Xuánzhēn? Is she Mù Qíng?

breakdown.meaning: same as above, used again for emphasis or repetition
is, be; to be (used for questions)

pinyin: Shì shuí chāi le wǒ de jīndiàn.
translation: Who destroyed my golden temple?

breakdown.meaning: destroyed (拆 = to destroy, 了 = particle indicating completion)
golden palace (金 = gold, 殿 = hall/temple)

pinyin: Gǔnchū lái.
translation: Get out of here and learn Chinese.

breakdown.meaning: to go out, to come out

pinyin: Nǐ chāi de?
translation: Did you tear it down?

pinyin: Hǎo gěi wǒ děng zhe.
translation: It's okay to wait for me.

breakdown.meaning: (particle indicating someone is waiting for me)

chinese: 拆你金殿的人就在这儿
pinyin: Chāinǐ jīndiàn de rén jiù zài zhèér.
translation: The man who took down your golden temple is here.

breakdown.meaning: golden palace or temple (金 = gold, 殿 = hall/temple)
(particle used to indicate possession or association)
to be at/to exist in a place

pinyin: Zì jǐ wèn bei.
translation: Ask yourself.

breakdown.meaning: (used after verbs to indicate an action is done, often with a sense of inevitability or resignation)

pinyin: Shì wǒ duì bù qǐ.
translation: It's my fault.

pinyin: Diàn xià nǎ shì nán yáng.
translation: Your Highness, that's Nanyang.

chinese: 我知道可他好像没认出我
pinyin: Wǒ zhīdào kě tā hǎo xiàng méi rènchūwǒ.
translation: I know, but he seems not to have recognized me.

breakdown.meaning: I know (我 = I, 知道 = know)
seems like, appears (好 = good Hao2, 像 = resemble Xi4)
did not recognize (没 = no, 认出 = to recognize)

chinese: 不他只是多在凡间不知你又飞升了
pinyin: Bù tā zhǐ shì duō zài fánjiān bùzhī nǐ yòu fēishēng le.
translation: He is just more often in the mortal world, not knowing that you have already ascended.

breakdown.meaning: mortal world (凡 = mortal, 间 = world)
not know (不 = not, 知 = know)
ascend, fly up (飞 = fly, 升 = rise)

pinyin: Zhūwèi fēicháng bàoqiàn.
translation: I'm very sorry for you.

breakdown.meaning: to apologize; sorry (抱 = to hold, 抱歉 is used as a single word for 'sorry')

chinese: 所有损失我会尽数奉还
pinyin: Suǒyǒu sǔnshī wǒ huì jìnshù fèng hái.
translation: I will return all the losses completely.

breakdown.meaning: all, every (所 = place/degree, 有 = have)
exhaustively, completely (尽 = exhaust, 数 = number)
to return, to pay back (奉 = present, 还 = return)

pinyin: Hái wàng gěi wǒ yī diǎn shí jiān.
translation: I would like to give you a little more time.

breakdown.meaning: still hope/expect (还 = still, 望 = to look forward)

chinese: 太子殿下最好是说话算话
pinyin: Tàizi diàn xià zuìhǎo shì shuōhuà suànhuà.
translation: His Royal Highness would do well to speak and keep his word.

breakdown.meaning: crown prince (太 = grand, 子 = son)
His Royal Highness (殿 = hall/palace, 下 = under)
to speak, words (说 = to speak, 话 = words)
to keep one's word, count as words (算 = to calculate, 话 = words)

pinyin: Hái yǒu gōngwù zài shēn.
translation: There is also official business remaining.

breakdown.meaning: public; official (as part of 公务)
affairs, business (as part of 公务)

chinese: 没其他事的话就先告辞了
pinyin: Méi qítā shì dehuà jiù xiāngào cí le.
translation: If there's nothing else, I'll take my leave now.

breakdown.meaning: other, another (其 = self/it, 其他 = other)
to take leave (告 = inform, 辞 = farewell)
(perfective particle, indicating completion of an action)

pinyin: Wǒ hái yǒu shì - wǒ xiān chè le.
translation: I have something to do - I'm leaving first.

breakdown.meaning: to withdraw; to cancel; to leave (as in leaving a place)
particle indicating completion or change of state

chinese: 溜了溜了-我也走了-我也是
pinyin: Liū le liū le - Wǒ yě zǒu le - Wǒ yě shì.
translation: I'm leaving now - I'm also going - Me too

breakdown.meaning: to slip away or leave quickly
past tense marker, indicating an action has been completed

pinyin: Bàoqiàn
translation: I'm sorry

chinese: 要是玄真没说话本可以借到人的
pinyin: Yào shì xuánzhēn méi shuō huà běn kěyǐ jièdào rén de.
translation: If Xuanzhen hadn't spoken, it would have been possible to borrow from someone.

pinyin: Méishì wǒ yī gè rén xíguàn le.
translation: I'm used to being alone, it's no big deal.

breakdown.meaning: nothing (no problem) (没 = not, 事 = thing)
alone (one person) (一 = one, 个 = unit, 人 = person)
used to (习惯 = accustomed, 了 = particle indicating completion)

pinyin: Nà nǐ xūyào fǎbǎo ma.
translation: Then do you need a magic weapon?

breakdown.meaning: to need (xū = to lack, yào = want)
magic weapon (法 = magic, 宝 = treasure/weapon)

pinyin: Yě bùyòng
translation: It doesn't work either

pinyin: Wǒ bèi biǎn liǎng cì fǎlì jǐnshī.
translation: I was demoted twice and lost all my magical powers.

breakdown.meaning: magic power (法 = magic, 力 = power)
lost all/completely lost (尽 = all, 失 = lose)

chinese: 到了凡间便用不了法宝
pinyin: Dào le fánjiān biàn yòng bù le fǎbǎo.
translation: You can't use magic weapons when you get there.

breakdown.meaning: mortal world (凡 = mortal, 间 = space/world)

pinyin: hǎo ba
translation: All right

breakdown.meaning: good, okay (好表示同意或接受)
particle, used to express confirmation or end of dialogue

pinyin: Cǐshì guānxì zhòngdà.
translation: It matters a lot.

chinese: 还请殿下务必谨慎行事
pinyin: Hái qǐng diān xià wù bì jĭn shèn xíng shì.
translation: PleaseYourHighnessbeextra-carefulinactions.

breakdown.meaning: action, conduct (行 = act, 事 = matter)

pinyin: Ruò yùnàn chù kě suíshí liánxì.
translation: If you encounter difficulties, you can contact us at any time.

breakdown.meaning: at any time/suddenly (随 = follow along, 时 = time)
to contact/connect (联 = link together, 系 = connect)

pinyin: Língwén diàn huì jǐn quán lì zhī chí.
translation: The Temple of Spirits will do its best to support it.

breakdown.meaning: Temple of Spirits (灵 = spirit, 文 = literature/diagram, 殿 = hall/palace)

pinyin: Tàizǐ diàn xià kěhái yǒu yíwèn.
translation: His Royal Highness still has questions.

breakdown.meaning: crown prince (太 = great, 子 = son)
Your Royal Highness (殿 = hall, 下 = below)
doubt, question (疑 = doubt, 问 = ask)

pinyin: Língwén zhè cì xièxiè nǐ le.
translation: Thank you, Ling Wen, this time.

pinyin: Wǒ zhǐ fùzé bǎnshì.
translation: I'm only in charge of things.

breakdown.meaning: to be in charge of/to be responsible (负 = to bear; 责 = responsibility)
to handle事物/affairs (办 = to manage; 事 = affair)

chinese: 要谢便等帝君回来你亲自谢他
pinyin: Yào xiè biànděng dì jūnhuí lái nǐ qīnzì xiè tā.
translation: Wait for the Emperor to return and thank him personally.

breakdown.meaning: emperor or lord (帝 = emperor, 君 = king/lord)
to return (回 = back, 来 = come)

chinese: 那便预祝殿下此去一帆风顺
pinyin: Nà biàn yùzhù diàn xià cǐ qù yī fān fēng shùn.
translation: May Your Highness have a smooth and favorable journey ahead.

breakdown.meaning: that, in this context used for emphasis or connection
to wish (someone) good luck or success beforehand (预 = beforehand, 祝 = to wish)
Your Highness (a respectful title for a prince or princess)
sailing with full sails (fig. to have a smooth and favorable journey)

pinyin: Tiān guān cì fú.
translation: God blesses you

pinyin: Bǎiwú jìnjì.
translation: Without restraint.

breakdown.meaning: hundred without; no restrictions (百 = hundred, 无 = without)
taboos; prohibitions (禁 = prohibit, 忌 = taboo)

chinese: 听 了 吗 与 君 山 上 又 出 事 了
pinyin: Tīng shuō le ma yǔ jūnshān shàng yòu chūshì le.
translation: Have you heard? Something happened again on Jun Mountain.

breakdown.meaning: particle used to indicate completion of an action
a question particle at the end of a sentence

pinyin: A ？ Yòu shīzōng yīgè.
translation: Oh no! Another has gone missing.

pinyin: Kě bù shì ma
translation: Not really.

breakdown.meaning: is/are or not (in this context, used in the negative form)

chinese: 哎哟什么时候是个头啊
pinyin: Āi yō shénme shíhòu shì gètóua.
translation: Oh, when will this ever end?

breakdown.meaning: time; when ( shí = time, hòu = period)
head; end ( gè = each/one, tóu = head)
particle used for emphasis or tone

pinyin: Yòu yī gè gūniáng zāoyāng le.
translation: Another girl met with misfortune.

breakdown.meaning: to meet with misfortune (遭 = encounter,  = disaster)

pinyin: Kèguān lǐ biān qǐng.
translation: Guest officer, please come in.

pinyin: Nín qǐngzuò.
translation: Please take a seat here.

breakdown.meaning: to sit, to take a seat

pinyin: Yī hú chá xiè xiè.
translation: A pot of tea, thank you.

breakdown.meaning: thank you (谢 = thank, 谢 = you)

pinyin: Éi.
translation: Eh

breakdown.meaning: Eh (a sound used to express surprise or uncertainty)

pinyin: Qǐngwèn.
translation: Excuse me

chinese: 近来附近可有什么怪事发生
pinyin: Jìnlái fùjìn kěyǒu shénme guàishì fāshēng.
translation: Can something strange happen nearby lately?

breakdown.meaning: have, can there be (可 = can, 有 = have)
strange incident (怪 = strange, 事 = matter/incident)

pinyin: Zhè  fēi lǐ wù yánfēi lǐ wù yán.
translation: Do not speak of impropriety, do not speak of impropriety.

pinyin: Tàizǐ diàn xià.
translation: His Royal Highness the Crown Prince

breakdown.meaning: Crown Prince (太 = grand, 子 = son)
Royal Highness (殿 = hall, 下 = under)

pinyin: Tàizi diàn xià?
translation: His Royal Highness?

breakdown.meaning: prince, crown prince (太 = grand, 子 = son)
His Royal Highness (殿 = hall, 下 = below)

pinyin: Língwén?
translation: Spirit?

breakdown.meaning: writing; literature (in this context, it combines with 灵 to suggest something spiritual)

pinyin: Diàn xiàhǎo xiāoxī.
translation: Good news for Your Highness.

breakdown.meaning: Your Highness (殿 = hall/royalty, 下 = below)
good news (好 = good, 信 = message, 息 = information)

chinese: 中天庭有两位小神官愿来助你一臂之力
pinyin: Zhōng tiān tíng yǒu liǎng wèi xiǎoshén guānyuàn lái zhù nǐ yī bì zhīlì.
translation: In the Heavenly Court, two minor deities are willing to come and lend you a helping hand.

breakdown.meaning: heavenly court (天 = heaven, 庭 = court)
a measure word for positions, like 'two'
minor deity (小 = small, 神 = god, 官 = official)
a helping hand; one arm's strength (一 = one, 臂 = arm, 之 = of, 力 = strength)

pinyin: Zhè huì érrén yīnggāi dào le ba.
translation: People should be here by now.

breakdown.meaning: arrived/reached (到 = arrive, 了 = marker for completed action)

pinyin: Xiǎoshénguān ？
translation: Little God?

pinyin: Líng wén ā.
translation: O Spirit!

breakdown.meaning: literature, writing; can also mean 'wen' (as in a surname)
an interjection used to express emphasis or emotion

pinyin: Tāmen bù xiàng lái zhù wǒ xíngshì.
translation: They don't seem to be here to help me act/behave.

breakdown.meaning: to come and help (lái = to come, zhù = to help)
to act/to behave (xíng = to walk/act, shì = matter/event)

pinyin: Gèng xiàng lái qǔ wǒ gǒu tóu.
translation: It's more like coming to take my dog's head.

breakdown.meaning: to come and take my dog's head

chinese: 你莫不是把人家诳过来。
translation: You are not tricking them to come here, are you?
pinyin: Nǐ mò bùshì bǎ rénjiā kuáng guòlái.

breakdown.meaning: is it not; used here to mean 'Are you'
particle indicating the object of a verb

pinyin: Língwén? Língwén?
translation: Spirit? Spirit?

pinyin: Qǐng wèn èr wèi shì?
translation: May I ask you two?

breakdown.meaning: to ask (请 = to invite/request, 问 = to ask)
two of you; second (二 = two, 位 = person)

pinyin: Nánfēng
translation: southerly

pinyin: Fúyáo
translation: To soar; to rise rapidly

breakdown.meaning: to shake, to swing; to tremble

pinyin: Bù shì wèn nǐ men míng zì a.
translation: I didn't ask your names.

breakdown.meaning: is, to be (negative particle with 不)

pinyin: Duōxiè èr wèi kěnlái xiāngzhù.
translation: Thank you so much for coming to help

breakdown.meaning: thank you (多 = many, 谢 = thank)
two of you/两位 (er4 wei4) - refers to two people
willing to come (肯 = willing, 来 = come)
help each other (相 = mutually, 助 = help)

chinese: 敢问二位来自哪位殿下座下
pinyin: Gǎn wèn èr wèi lái zì nǎ wèi diàn xià zuò xià.
translation: Dare I ask where you two come from, Your Highness?

breakdown.meaning: (Your) Highness;殿下 refers to a nobleman or prince
under your seat; respectfully addressing someone in authority

pinyin: Nányáng diàn
translation: Nanyang Temple

chinese: 所所以是你们家将军派你们来的？
pinyin: Suǒsuǒ yǐshì nǐ men jiā jiāng jūnpài nǐ men lái de?
translation: Are you the ones sent by your general?

breakdown.meaning: your family/home (你 = you, 们 = plural marker, 家 = home)
you come (你 = you, 们 = plural marker, 来 = to come)

pinyin: Wǒ jiā jiāngjūn bùzhī cǐshì.
translation: My general doesn't know about it.

pinyin: Wǒ jiā jiāngjūn yě bùzhī
translation: My general doesn't know either.

breakdown.meaning: doesn't know (不 = not, 知 = know)

pinyin: Nà nǐmen  zhīdào wǒ shì shuí ma
translation: So you guys... do you know who I am?

breakdown.meaning: you (plural) (你 = you, 们 = plural marker)
to know, to be aware (知 = knowledge, 了 = marker for completed action)
question particle used at the end of a sentence

pinyin: Zhūwèi fēicháng bàoqiàn.
translation: I'm very sorry for you.

breakdown.meaning: you all (众 = many, 位 = person)
sorry (抱 = to hold, 歉 = ashamed)

pinyin: Hēng
translation: hum

breakdown.meaning: to hum; often used to express contempt or exasperation

pinyin: Rènwù xiángqíng zàicǐ.
translation: The task details are here.

breakdown.meaning: task (任 = to take on, 务 = task)
are here (在 = in/at, 此 = this/here)

pinyin: Hǎo.
translation: Good

chinese: 听 了 吗 与 君 山 上 又 出 事 了。
pinyin: Tīngshuō le ma yǔ jūnshān shàng yòu chūshì le.
translation: Have you heard? Something happened again on Jun Mountain.

breakdown.meaning: to hear the news (听 = to listen, 说 = to speak)
question particle used in yes/no questions
to have an accident or incident (出 = to go out/come out, 事 = matter/incident)

pinyin: Zhè … fēi lǐ wù yán fēi lǐ wù yán.
translation: Do not speak of impropriety, do not speak of impropriety.

breakdown.meaning: do not speak (勿 = do not, 言 = speak)

chinese: 你莫不是把人家诳了过来
pinyin: Nǐ mò búshì bǎ rénjiā kuáng le guòlái.
translation: Are you trying to trick someone into coming here?

breakdown.meaning: particle indicating the action is directed toward someone or something
someone else's house; another person's home

pinyin: Xuánzhēn diàn
translation: Xuanzhen Temple

pinyin: Nà nǐmen … zhīdào wǒ shì shuí ma.
translation: Do you guys know who I am?

breakdown.meaning: am, is, are (used as a copula)
particle used to turn a statement into a question

pinyin: Nǐ shì tàizi diàn xià.
translation: You are Your Highness the Prince.

pinyin: Nǐ shì rénjiān zhèngdào.
translation: You are the right way on earth.

breakdown.meaning: right way/path (正 = right, 道 = way)

pinyin: Nǐ shì shìjiè zhōngxīn.
translation: You are the center of the world!

pinyin: Tā shì búshì fānle gè báiyǎn.
translation: Did he roll his eyes?

breakdown.meaning: is not ( contraction of 是 and 不是)
roll an (used to indicate a single action of rolling)
white eye (refers to rolling one's eyes)

pinyin: Shì ràng tā gǔn.
translation: It's for him to get out.

pinyin: Píng shénme yào gǔn nǐ gǔn.
translation: Why do you want to get out, you get out.

pinyin: Děng yī xià děng yī xià.
translation: Wait wait.

breakdown.meaning: down, next; (when used after a verb) indicates the completion or result of an action

pinyin: Nǐmen zhēn shì zìyuàn ma?
translation: Are you really volunteering?

breakdown.meaning: you (plural) (你 = you, 们 = plural marker)

pinyin: Cǐshì bù bì miǎn qiáng.
translation: It doesn't have to be forced.

breakdown.meaning: to force oneself,勉强 (as part of the compound word)

pinyin: Wǒ · zì · yuàn.
translation: I want to...

pinyin: nà yán guī zhèng chuán.
translation: That's true.

chinese: 这与君山附近有一个传说
pinyin: Zhè yǔ jūnshān fùjìn yǒu yī gè chuánshuō.
translation: There is a legend near Junshan.

breakdown.meaning: particle indicating a single object or quantity
legend; myth (传 = to pass on, 说 = to speak)

chinese: 说山里住着一个诡新郎
pinyin: Shuō shān lǐ zhù zhe yī gè guǐ xīnláng.
translation: It is said that in the mountains, there lives a strange groom.

pinyin: Miànmào chǒu lòu xíngzōng guǐyì.
translation: Ugly face, mysterious whereabouts.

pinyin: Zhuān qiǎng chūjià de xīnniáng.
translation: A bride specializing in rushing into marriage.

breakdown.meaning: the act of a daughter getting married; leaving home for her husband's family

pinyin: Guòqù jìn bǎi nián jiān.
translation: Nearly 100 years have passed.

pinyin: Yǐ yǒu shíqī míng xīnniáng shīzōng.
translation: 17 brides are missing.

pinyin: Shàng bǎi míng sòng qīn rén yùnàn.
translation: Hundreds of people sending off relatives who encountered disaster.

pinyin: Zhè shì yuánběn chuán bù dào tiānshàng.
translation: This was not meant to be transmitted to heaven.

chinese: 但恰恰第十七位新娘父亲是个官老爷
pinyin: Dàn qiàqià dìshíqī wèi xīn niáng fù qīn shì gè guān lǎoyé.
translation: But precisely the seventeenth bride's father was an old government official.

breakdown.meaning: the seventeenth (第 = order/rank, 十 = ten, 七 = seven, 位 = position)
father (父 = father, 亲 = parent/close one)
a, an (measure word for singular countable nouns)
old government official (官 = official, 老爷 = old master/husband)

pinyin: Dāngchū fēngwén cǐdì chuánshuō
translation: The legend of this place was first smelled.

breakdown.meaning: (used after verbs to indicate just started)

chinese: 精心挑选了四十名勇武绝伦的随侍护送爱女成亲
pinyin: Jīngxīn tiāoxuǎn le sìshí míng yǒngwǔ juélún de suíshì hùsòng àinǚ chéng qīn.
translation: Carefully selected forty brave and extraordinary escorts to accompany his beloved daughter to her wedding.

breakdown.meaning: to select or choose (挑 = to pick, 选 = selection)
particle indicating completion or past tense
count; in this context, refers to people
brave and martially skilled (勇 = brave, 武 = martial arts)
extraordinary or peerless (绝 = exceptional, 伦 = comparable)
particle used for possession or description
escorts or attendants who follow (随 = to follow, 侍 = attendant)
to escort or accompany (护 = to protect, 送 = to send)
beloved daughter (爱 = love, 女 = daughter)
to get married (成 = to complete, 亲 = marriage or family)

pinyin: Piānpiān nǚér háishì méile.
translation: The partial daughter is still gone.

pinyin: Nà guān lǎoyé àinǚ rúmìng.
translation: The official loved his daughter with a passion that surpassed his own life.

breakdown.meaning: old sir/master (a respectful term for an older man)
love daughter (爱 = love, 女 = daughter)
as if life (如 = like/as, 命 = life)

chinese: 暴怒之下联合一众官朋友
pinyin: Bào nù zhī xià, lián hé yī zhòng guān péng yǒu.
translation: In a fit of rage, he joined forces with his official friends.

breakdown.meaning: under, below; in the situation of (之 = pronoun marker, 下 = under)
to unite, to join forces (联 = connect, 合 = combine)
a group of; a crowd (一 = one, 众 = many)
official friends; friends in official positions (官 = official, 朋 = friend, 友 = friend)

pinyin: Qīngjǐn quánlì qífú qǐngyuàn.
translation: Do your best to pray and make requests for blessings.

breakdown.meaning: to倾倒, pour out (literally); to give one's all (figuratively)

pinyin: Hái zhòngjīn xuánshǎng guǐ xīnláng.
translation: Also heavily rewarded with a reward for the groom.

chinese: 搞得整个北方不得安宁
pinyin: Gǎo děi zhènggě běifāng bùdé ānníng.
translation: Make the whole north restless and unsafe.

breakdown.meaning: peaceful, calm (安 = peace, 宁 = quiet)

chinese: 这 才 惊 动 了 上边 的 神官。
pinyin: zhè cái jīngdòng le shàngbiān de shénguān.
translation: That's what shocked the gods above.

pinyin: Wǒmen cǐcì de mùbiāo.
translation: Our goal this time.

breakdown.meaning: possessive particle (used to indicate possession or relation)

pinyin: Biànshì zhuādào zhè guǐ xīn láng.
translation: is to catch the strange groom.

chinese: 失踪新娘可有共同之处
pinyin: Shīzōng xīn niáng kě yǒu gòngtóng zhī chù.
translation: Is There a Common Thread Among Missing Brides?

breakdown.meaning: missing, lost (失 = lose, 踪 = trace)

chinese: 有穷有富有美有丑有妻有妾
pinyin: Yǒu qióngyǒu fùyǒu měi yǒu chǒuyǒu qīyǒu qiè.
translation: There are poor and rich, beautiful and ugly, wives and concubines.

breakdown.meaning: have poverty (有 = have, 穷 = poor)
have wealth/riches (富 = rich, 有 = have)

pinyin: Yī yánbì zhī háowú guīlǜ.
translation: In a word, completely random

breakdown.meaning: particle used for emphasis or possession

pinyin: Yǒu shuí jiàn guò zhè guǐ xīnláng.
translation: Has anyone ever seen this strange bridegroom?

breakdown.meaning: strange bridegroom (诡 = strange, 新郎 = bridegroom)

pinyin: Bìng wú
translation: No, I don't

breakdown.meaning: together; and (here used in a negative response)

chinese: 既无人见过你又怎知是诡新郎不是别的什么
pinyin: Jì wú rén jiàn guò nǐ yòu zěn zhī shì guǐ xīnláng bù shì bié de shénme.
translation: Since no one has seen you, how can you tell if the strange groom is not something else?

breakdown.meaning: thing, matter (used in 什么 as 么)

pinyin: Guǐxīnláng zhǐ shì yī gè jiàofǎ.
translation: The treacherous groom is just a term.

breakdown.meaning: treacherous groom (诡 = ghostly/mysterious, 新 = new/newly married man)
term, name (叫 = to call, 法 = method)

pinyin: Bùguò nǐ shuō de yǒulǐ.
translation: But you have a point.

breakdown.meaning: (particle connecting a noun and an adjective)

pinyin: Tiān sè bù zǎo le.
translation: It's getting late.

breakdown.meaning: color; in this context, it means 'it' (as part of 天色)
particle indicating completion or state change

chinese: 先找个落脚地再讨论吧
pinyin: Xiān zhǎogè luòjiǎo dì zài tǎolùn ba.
translation: Let's first find a place to stand and then discuss it.

breakdown.meaning: particle used to quantify nouns ( Classifier )
place to stand ( 落 = settle, 脚 = foot/place, 地 = place)

chinese: 先找个落脚地再讨论吧
pinyin: Xiān zhǎogè luòjiǎo dì zài tǎolùn ba.
translation: Let's find a place to discuss it first.

breakdown.meaning: a place to land, a temporary place to stay

chinese: 谁家的姑娘啊...-在这个当口送亲啊
pinyin: Shuí jiā de gūniánga ... - Zài zhè gè dàngǒu sòngqīna.
translation: Whose daughter is this... - Sending her off to marriage at this moment.

breakdown.meaning: aunt (maternal), or a type of wasp in certain dialects
mother, daughter-in-law; also a term of endearment for daughter
moment, critical juncture (when '当' means right, and '口' means mouth/moment)
relative, in-law; marriage (in the context of '送亲', it refers to sending off a daughter in marriage)

pinyin: Nà shì ….
translation: Is that...

chinese: 还有人不怕死敢来送亲都被抓走了
pinyin: Hái yǒu rén bù pà sǐ gǎn lái sòng qīn dōu bèi zhūa zǒu le.
translation: Even those who were not afraid of death and dared to come to the wedding were all arrested, and some people were even caught.

breakdown.meaning: still; there are still (还 = still, 有 = have)
not afraid of death (不 = not, 怕 = afraid, 死 = death)
dared to come (敢 = dare, 来 = come)
send the bride or groom (送 = send, 亲 = relative/closely related person)
all were arrested and taken away (都 = all, 被 = be, 抓走 = caught/arrested)

pinyin: Zhèxiē rén bù duìjìn.

breakdown.meaning: (duì = right, jìn = strength/mood; something is wrong)

pinyin: Qù kànkàn.

breakdown.meaning: to look, to watch, to see
to look, to watch, to see

pinyin: Nǐmen kuài zhùshǒu.

breakdown.meaning: stop, cease doing something (住 = stop, 住手 = literally 'stop hand')

pinyin: Kuài tíng xià lái.

breakdown.meaning: down; below; after (here used as an auxiliary particle to indicate completion or direction)

pinyin: Ràng kāi
translation: Get out of the way

chinese: 姑娘他们只想用你引出诡新郎
pinyin: Gūnīang tāmen zhǐ xiǎng yòng nǐ yǐnchū guǐ xīnláng.

breakdown.meaning: to expose or reveal (引 = lead, 出 = out)
strange groom (诡 = strange, 新 = new, 郎 = groom)

pinyin: Nǐ mòyào bèi piàn le.

breakdown.meaning: 被动 particle indicating passive voice

pinyin: Ràng kāi
translation: Get out of the way

pinyin: Shì gèjiǎ de.

breakdown.meaning: a measure word for countable nouns
possessive particle indicating 'of' or used to specify a noun (e.g., 的确 = indeed)

pinyin: Hēng hǎo a, yòu shì nǐ.

breakdown.meaning: it's you again (又 = again, 是 = is, 你 = you)

chinese: 你这臭婆娘总坏老子好事
pinyin: Nǐ zhè chòupóniáng zǒnghuài lǎozi hǎoshì.

breakdown.meaning: damn woman (a derogatory term for a wife)
my old man (used here as a possessive pronoun, similar to 'my')

pinyin: Yào shì nǐ kěn bǎn xīn niáng.
translation: If you're willing to dress up as a bride.

chinese: 老子也不会弄块儿木头作饵

breakdown.meaning: an archaic term for 'father' or 'old man'
to know how, to be able to
a small piece (块 = piece, 儿 = diminutive suffix)
wooden stick or piece of wood
to use as, to serve as (used in compounds)

pinyin: Hǎochǒu de yātou.

breakdown.meaning: girl (daughters; term of address for a female child)

chinese: 扶摇不能这样说女孩子，

child (a suffix or standalone meaning child)

chinese: 那不是小彭头和小萤姑娘吗
pinyin: Nà búshì xiǎo péng tóu hé xiǎo yínggū niángma?

breakdown.meaning: Xiao Peng (a name, likely short for 彭某人 or similar)
Xiao Ying (a name, likely short for 萤某人 or similar)
(used at the end of a sentence to turn it into a question)

pinyin: Hái zhēn shì.

chinese: 这个小彭头成天带着一群泼皮
pinyin: Zhè gè xiǎo péngtóu chéngtiān dài zhe yī qún pōpí.

to carry along, in context means 'hangs out'

pinyin: Zhěngxiē wāi mén xié dào de.

breakdown.meaning: crooked door (歪 = twisted, 门 = door)
evil way (邪 = wicked, 道 = path/way)

chinese: 最近又盯上官老爷的悬赏
pinyin: Zuìjìn yòu dīng shàngguān lǎoyé de xuánshǎng.

breakdown.meaning: to keep looking at, to eye
lord, master; here used as a title of respect for officials
reward, bounty (悬 = hanging/suspended, 赏 = reward)

pinyin: Yào zhūa shénme guǐ xīnláng.
translation: What a weird groom to catch.

pinyin: Nǐ nǐmen bié tīng tā de.
translation: Don't listen to him.

breakdown.meaning: a suffix added to pronouns to indicate plurality, meaning 'you all' in this context
don't (alternative way of saying 不要，used for imperative mood)
possessive particle indicating 'of' or 'belonging to', used here as 'his'

chinese: 与君山那么危险不要去
pinyin: Yǔ Jūnshān nàme wēixiǎn búyào qù.
translation: Don't go to Junjian Mountain, it's so dangerous.

pinyin: Tā Tā zhǐ shì xiǎng yào shǎngjīn.

breakdown.meaning: bounty, reward (赏 = to grant, 金 = gold)

pinyin: Xiào! Ná diǎn qián zěnme le.
translation: Shh! What's wrong with asking for some money?

chinese: 大家伙儿不也顺道为民除害了吗
pinyin: Dàjiā huǒ'ér bùyě shùndào wèi mín chúhài le ma.
translation: Didn't we also take the opportunity to eliminate harm for the people?

breakdown.meaning: comrade, partner (in phrases like 大家伙儿)
particle used in informal speech to address someone, similar to 'you guys' or 'everyone'
particle indicating completion of an action
particle used to soften the tone or express doubt; similar to 'hmm' or 'ya know'

pinyin: Kě bù! Zhè qián hái shǎo le ne.
translation: Not yet! This money is still insufficient at all.

breakdown.meaning: lacks, is missing (used as a measure word)
particle used in questions or exclamations, similar to 'at all'

pinyin: Dàn dàn zhè búshì zài sòngsǐ ma?

breakdown.meaning: at, in; to be (used for location)
used to turn a statement into a question, similar to 'isn't' or 'aren't'

chinese: 之前让你假扮新娘子你不肯
pinyin: Zhīqián ràng nǐ jiǎ bàn xīn niángzi nǐ bù kěn.

breakdown.meaning: to pretend to play (假 = fake, 假扮 = to pretend)
bride (新 = new/fresh, 娘 = daughter, 子 = child)

pinyin: Xiànzài wǒmen yào qù zhuārén.

breakdown.meaning: to want/to intend to do something
to catch someone (抓 = to catch, 人 = person)

pinyin: Nǐ yòulái lánlù.

breakdown.meaning: come again, come back (又 = again, 来 = to come)
to stop the road; to intercept traffic (拦 = to block, 路 = road)

pinyin: Nǐ dàodǐ shénme yìsī.
translation: What the hell do you mean?

pinyin: Jìu shì nǐ shuō ya.
translation: That's what you say.

chinese: 什么意思你-这么不想让人去
pinyin: Shé·me yì·sī nǐ - zhème bù xiǎng ràng rén qù.

chinese: 敢情那诡新郎是你的相好啊-你胡说什么
pinyin: Gǎn qíng nà guǐ xīnláng shì nǐ de xiānghǎo a - nǐ húshuō shénme.

breakdown.meaning: so it turns out (敢 = dare, 情 = situation)
strange groom (诡 = strange, 新 = new, 郎 = groom)
is your lover huh (是 = is, 你 = you, 相好 = lover (相 = mutual, 好 = good))
what nonsense are you talking about (你 = you, 胡说 = nonsense (胡 = random, 说 = speak), 什么 = what)

chinese: 你隔三差五就往与君山里跑
pinyin: Nǐ gé sān chàwǔ jiù wǎng yǔ jūnshān lǐ pǎo.

breakdown.meaning: every three to five (informal expression for 'occasionally')

breakdown.pinyin: jiù wǎng yǔ jūnshān lǐ pǎo

pinyin: Dàhuǒ dōu kàn dào le ba.

breakdown.meaning: to reach/to arrive; (as a verb particle) indicating arrival or completion
(particle used to indicate completion of an action)
a modal particle indicating uncertainty, suggestion, or request (similar to 'right?' or 'you know?')

pinyin: a zhè ... - jiùshì.

pinyin: Lǎoshí jiāodài

breakdown.meaning: together; mutually, or good-looking (as in 相好)

pinyin: Wǒ bù zhīdào.

breakdown.meaning: to know (as part of 知道)
way/path; in this context, part of 'to know'

pinyin: Nǐ … nǐmen bié guòlái.

pinyin: qī rén tàishèn.

breakdown.meaning: serious; grave; extreme (in this context, emphasizes the extent of deception)

pinyin: Ruò diān xià néng dài wèi qù yī tàng.

breakdown.meaning: if Your Highness (lit. 'if the palace descendant')
(is able to) act on behalf of

chinese: 刚才灵文殿说帝君要借人
pinyin: Gāng cái língwén diàn shuō dì jūnyào jiè rén.
translation: The Temple of Lingwen said that the Emperor wanted to borrow someone.

breakdown.meaning: Temple of Lingwen (灵 = spirit/mysterious, 文 = literature/culture, 殿 = hall/palace)
borrow someone (借 = borrow, 人 = person)

pinyin: Qǐngwèn … gé xià zěnme chēnghū.

breakdown.meaning: may I ask (请 = please, 问 = ask)
a respectful term for addressing someone; similar to 'sir' or 'you' (阁 = a measure word for floors/buildings, 下 = down/under)
name; way of addressing (称 = to call/names, 呼 = call)

pinyin: Shì wǒ duì bù qǐ.
translation: It's my fault.

breakdown.meaning: to get up/rise; in this context, it means to express regret (literally 'to rise')

chinese: 听听说了 吗与君山上又出事了
pinyin: Tīngshuō le ma yǔ jūnshān shàng yòu chūshì le.
translation: Have you heard? Something happened again on Jun Mountain.

breakdown.meaning: question particle used at the end of questions

chinese: 这 才 惊动了 上边的 神官
pinyin: Zhè cái jīngdòng le shàngbiān de shénguān.
translation: That's what shocked the gods above.

breakdown.meaning: only, just (used to emphasize degree or condition)
shocked (惊 = shock, 动 = move; 了 indicates completion)
upper part of (上 = above, 边 = edge; 的 is a possessive particle)

pinyin: Shénme rén
translation: What people

breakdown.meaning: a prefix meaning 'what' (used in compound words)
a suffix meaning 'what' or used to add a tone of doubt

chinese: 扶摇不能这样说女孩子
pinyin: Fúyáo bùnéng zhèyàng shuō nǚ háizi.
translation: Fuyao cannot say this to a girl.

breakdown.meaning: word suffix indicating smallness or affection

pinyin: Jìn ! ná diǎn qián zěn me le
translation: Shh! What's wrong with asking for some money?

breakdown.meaning: to be quiet, to stop talking
take some money (拿 = to take, 点 = some, 钱 = money)

chinese: 听说这诡新郎满脸绷带奇丑无比
pinyin: Tīngshuō zhè guǐ xīnláng mǎnliǎn bēngdài qíchǒu wúbǐ.
translation: I heard that the strange groom was wearing bandages all over his face and looked incredibly ugly.

breakdown.meaning: to hear someone say (听 = to hear, 说 = to speak)
groom (新 = new, 僚 = male attendant)
all over the face (满 = full, 脸 = face)
bandages (绷 = to bind, 带 = strip)
very ugly (奇 = strange, 丑 = ugly)

pinyin: Gēn nǐ hái ...
translation: With you also...

pinyin: Nǐ nǐ shì shénme rén.

breakdown.meaning: particle used in 'shénme' to mean what

pinyin: Zhè rén shǐ yāofǎ! Gěi wǒ shàng.

breakdown.meaning: to use, to practice (in the sense of magic or supernatural abilities)
demon magic/dark arts (妖 = demon, 法 = law/method)
on, upon; to treat (in the sense of treating a demon)

pinyin: Nn̄g? Lái ya.

breakdown.meaning: particle used to express invitation or encouragement (like 'oh' or 'ah')

pinyin: Bùdǎ le
translation: Don't fight anymore

pinyin: Jīn tiānsuàn nǐ yíngnǐ bié déyì.
translation: Today you win, don't be too proud of yourself.

breakdown.meaning: you win or it's your turn (算 = to count/calculate, 你 = you)
to get; to obtain (used here in '得意')

pinyin: Zán men zǒu zhe qiáo.

breakdown.meaning: to walk (with aspect particle 着 indicating ongoing action)

pinyin: Zhùzi jìde péi ā.
translation: The pillar remembers to compensate or pay back.

breakdown.meaning: pillar/column (柱 = pillar, 子 = child/used in some nouns)
to remember (记 = to remember, 得 = used after verbs to form the continuous aspect or perfective tone)
particle used for emphasis or drawing attention

pinyin: Zhī dào le
translation: Got it.

pinyin: Gūnīang kěyǒu shòushāng.
translation: The girl may have been injured.

pinyin: Nǐ nǐ yào gàn shénme.
translation: What are you going to do?

breakdown.meaning: to want; to go to do something

pinyin: Gūniáng nǐ.
translation: Girl, you.

pinyin: Ā! Lóng huáng.
translation: Oh, rascal!

breakdown.meaning: an exclamation particle (a) used to express surprise or emphasis

pinyin: Nǐ qún zipò le.
translation: Your skirt is broken.

breakdown.meaning: suffix for possession or diminution, no meaning in this context
particle indicating completion of an action

pinyin: Suǒyǐ yǐhòu shǎoguǎn xiánshì.
translation: So don't do anything in the future.

breakdown.meaning: place, all (in this context: part of 'so')
afterwards, future (以 = use/reason, 后 = after)
idle matters (闲 = idle, 事 = matters)

pinyin: Xíngzhàng qīng le nǐ men zǒuba.
translation: The accounts are settled, you can go now.

pinyin: Xièxiè zhǎng guì.
translation: Thank you for the palm cabinet.

chinese: 对了不知离这最近的明光庙怎么走
pinyin: Duìle bù zhīlí zhè zuìjìn de míngguāng miào zěnme zǒu.
translation: Excuse me, how do I get to the nearest Mingguang Temple from here?

breakdown.meaning: excuse me/speaking of (对 = correct/right, 了 = particle)
from here (离 = leave/away from, 这 = this)
the nearest (最 = most, 近 = near, 的 = possessive particle)
Mingguang Temple (明 = bright, 光 = light, 庙 = temple)
how to go (怎 = how, 么 = particle, 走 = walk/go)

chinese: 明光庙？我们这没有明光庙
pinyin: Míngguāng miào ？ Wǒmen zhè méiyóu míngguāng miào.
translation: The Temple of Light? We don't have a Temple of Light here.

breakdown.meaning: we (我 = I, 们 = plural marker)
don't have, doesn't exist (没 = not, 有 = have)

pinyin: Méiyǒu ？
translation: No?

pinyin: Zěnme huì.
translation: How come?

pinyin: Bùguò … dǎoyóu yī jiān Nányáng miào.
translation: But... there is actually a South Yang altar/mostemple in Nanyang.

breakdown.meaning: a (used before nouns to indicate quantity)

pinyin: lí zhèér wǔlǐ dì.
translation: It's five miles from here.

breakdown.meaning: place; in this context, it is used as a suffix to indicate distance.

pinyin: Chū le chéng yòu zhuǎn jiù shì le.
translation: Turn right after leaving the city.

chinese: 奇怪北方明明是明光将军的地盘
pinyin: Qí guài běifāng míngmíng shì míngguāng jiāngjūn de dìpán.
translation: Strange, the North clearly belongs to General Ming Guang.

breakdown.meaning: clearly (明 = clear, 明明 is an emphasized form of 'clear')
general/military leader (将 = general, 军 = military)

pinyin: Què jìngrán zhǐ yǒu nányáng miào.
translation: But there is only the Nanyang Temple.

breakdown.meaning: yang (a surname or part of place names)

chinese: 南阳真君主东南在北方的香火竟也这般旺盛啊
pinyin: Nányáng zhēn jūnzhǔ dōngnán zài běifāng de xiāng huǒ jìng yě zhèbān wàngshèng a.
translation: The True Lord of Nanyang, worshipped in the southeast, is surprisingly thriving even in the north.

breakdown.meaning: particle used for emphasis or感叹

pinyin: Bùcuò bùcuò shēn shòu ài dāi.
translation: Not bad, not bad, deeply loved and respected.

breakdown.meaning: not bad (不 = not, 错 = mistake)
deeply feel/love (深 = deep, 受 = receive)
to love and respect (爱 = love, 戴 = respect)

pinyin: Dàn wǒ yǒu gè yíwèn bùzhī.
translation: But I have a doubt I don't know.

breakdown.meaning: to have; there is/are; he/she/it has
a (measure word for counting individual items)
doubt, question (疑 = doubt, 问 = ask)

chinese: 不知当讲不当讲那就不要讲
pinyin: Bùzhī dāngjiǎng bùdàng jiǎngnà jiù bù yào jiǎng.
translation: Whether it's appropriate to speak or not, it's better not to speak.

breakdown.meaning: not knowing (不 = not, 知 = know)
should speak/proper to speak (当 = when/should, 讲 = speak)
should not speak (不 = not, 当 = should/speak)
speak that (讲 = speak, 那 = that)
do not speak (不 = do not, 要 = want, 讲 = speak)

chinese: 其实我想说不知有谁能解答
pinyin: Qí shí wǒ xiǎng shuō bù zhī yǒu shuí néng jiě dá.
translation: Actually, I want to say that I don't know if anyone can answer.

breakdown.meaning: I want to (我 = I, 想 = to think/want)
don't know (不 = not, 知 = to know)
can answer (能 = can, 解答 = to solve/answer)

chinese: 太子殿下是不是想问南阳庙的典故
pinyin: Tàizǐ diǎnxià shì búshì xiǎngwèn nányáng miào de diǎngù.
translation: Your Highness, are you wondering about the story behind the Nanyang Temple?

breakdown.meaning: crown prince (大 = big, 子 = son)
Is it not?/Isn't it? (used to confirm or question)
to ask, to wonder (想 = want; 问 = ask)
Nanyang Temple (南 = south, 阳 = yang, 庙 = temple)
the story behind it (的 = possessive particle; 典故 = story/anecdote)

pinyin: Diǎngù.
translation: Allusion

pinyin: Nǐ bì zuǐ.
translation: You keep quiet.

breakdown.meaning: shut/close (often refers to closing one's mouth)

chinese: 很久以前南阳将军曾叫俱阳将军
pinyin: Hěnjiǔ yǐqián Nányáng jiāngjūn céng jiào Jùyáng jiāngjūn.
translation: Long ago, the General of Nanyang once called the General of Juyang.

breakdown.meaning: very long time (很 = very,久 = long)
before, ago (以 = before, 前 = front/ago)
general, military leader (将 = general, 军 = army/military)

chinese: 可那时有个糊涂的国君错把俱阳写成臣阳
pinyin: Kěnà shí yǒu gè hú tú de guó jūncuò bǎ jùyáng xiě chéng chényáng.
translation: At that time, a confused monarch mistakenly wrote Juyang as Chenyang.

breakdown.meaning: confused, silly (糊 = confused, 涴 = stupid)
monarch, king (国 = country, 君 = ruler)
particle indicating the object of an action

chinese: 全天下的俱阳庙都改了名
pinyin: Quán tiān xià de jù yáng miào dōu gǎi le míng.
translation: All day long, the temple was renamed.

breakdown.meaning: Juyang Temple (a proper noun, no further breakdown needed)
(auxiliary particle indicating completion of an action)

pinyin: Jiù zhème yī chuán shíshí chuán bǎi.
translation: It's just this way that it gets passed from ten to ten and then to a hundred.

pinyin: Cuòzì zǎo yǐ xiūzhèng.
translation: The typo has long since been corrected.

pinyin: Yǒu shénme yòng ne.
translation: What's the use?

breakdown.meaning: particle indicating a tag question or emphasis

chinese: 时至今日来南阳庙的依然是女客居多吧
pinyin: Shí zhì jīnrì lái nányáng miào de yīrán shì nǚ kèjū duō ba.
translation: Even today, those visiting the Nanyang Temple are still mostly female visitors.

breakdown.meaning: Nanyang Temple (南 = south, 阳 = yang, 庙 = temple)
female visitors (女 = female, 客 = guest)
mostly (居 = to live, 多 = many)
(sentence ending particle indicating inference or expectation)

chinese: 还一个个含羞带怯小脸通红
pinyin: Hái yī gè gè hán xiūdài qiè xiǎo liǎntònghóng.
translation: Each one with a shy and bashful face blushing red.

pinyin: Shǎo yīnyáng guàiqì.
translation: Less yin and yang strange.

pinyin: Xián dé huāng jiù sǎo dì qù.
translation: I was so idle that I swept the floor and went out.

breakdown.meaning: idle; bored to death (闲 = idle, 得 = particle indicating degree, 慌 = nervous/restless)
to sweep the floor (扫 = to sweep, 地 = ground)

pinyin: Nǐ shuō shénme.
translation: What did you say?

breakdown.meaning: particle used in questions to mean 'what', etc.

chinese: 当年你家将军不就是给太子殿下端茶送水扫地铺床的么
pinyin: Dāngnián nǐ jiā jiāng jūn bù jiù shì gěi tàizi diàn xià duān chá sòngshuǐ sǎo dì pù chuáng de me.
translation: Back then, wasn't your general the one who served the Crown Prince by bringing tea, water, sweeping floors, and making the bed?

breakdown.meaning: back then (当 = when/during, 年 = year)
your family/home (你 = you, 家 = family/home)
general/military officer (将 = will or military officer, 军 = army)
wasn't just (不 = not, 就是 = just is)
Crown Prince (太 = heir, 子 = son; 下殿 = palace/royal house)
serve tea (端 = to serve, 茶 = tea)
bring water (送 = to bring/give, 水 = water)
sweep floor (扫 = sweep, 地 = ground/floor)
make bed (铺 = to lay down/sleep, 床 = bed)

chinese: 听你这话说的还以为南阳殿多为太子殿下打抱不平呢
pinyin: Tīng nǐ zhèhuà shuō de hái yǐwéi nányáng diàn duō wèi tàizi diàn xià dǎbào bùpíng ne.
translation: Listening to you, one would think that the Nanyang Palace is standing up for the Crown Prince.

breakdown.meaning: Nanyang Palace (南 = south, 阳 = yang, 殿 = palace)
Crown Prince (太子 = crown prince, 下 = below)

chinese: 你家将军倒确实忘恩负义
pinyin: Nǐ jiā jiāngjūn dào quèshí wàngēn fùyì.
translation: Your general is indeed really ungrateful.

breakdown.meaning: your home/your family (你 = you, 家 = home)

chinese: 太子当年飞升还点了他的将
pinyin: Tàizǐ dāngnián fēishēng hái diǎn le tā de jiāng.
translation: The prince flew up and ordered his general.

chinese: 结果太子被贬他立刻过河拆桥
pinyin: Jiéguǒ tàizi bèi biǎn, tā lìkè guòhé chāiqiáo.
translation: As a result, the crown prince was demoted, and he immediately crossed the river and destroyed the bridge.

breakdown.meaning: result; consequence (结 = to tie/connect, 果 = fruit/result)
crown prince (太 = too/grand, 子 = son/royal child)
was demoted/degraded (被 = passive voice marker, 贬 = to demote)
to cross the river (过 = to cross, 河 = river)
to destroy the bridge (拆 = to dismantle/destroy, 桥 = bridge)

pinyin: Hái bùxǔ rén tí zhè duàn chǒushì.
translation: No one is allowed to mention this ugly thing.

breakdown.meaning: ugly thing (丑 = ugly, 事 = thing)

chinese: 你家将军也不过五十步笑百步
pinyin: Nǐ jiā jiāngjūn yě bùguò wǔshí bù xiào bǎi bù.
translation: Your general is no more than fifty steps away from laughing at a hundred steps.

chinese: 说是太子侍卫忠心耿耿
pinyin: Shuō shì tàizi shìwèi zhōngxīn gěnggěng.
translation: It is said that the prince was a loyal guard.

breakdown.meaning: crown prince (太 = great, 子 = son)
attendant, guard (侍 = serve, 卫 = protect)
loyal heart; loyal and dedicated (忠 = loyal, 心 = heart)
